topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53657d2d6368720ed08c0200#post_53657d2d6368720ed08c0200
It's not really fantasy, More like a Mecha anime where a Time/space Oscillation bomb ends up Mashing a bunch of different dimensions into Some sort of Composite universe
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53657e2d6368724846a70100#post_53657e2d6368724846a70100
That is a bit like Sheatheria (the project which is the source of these pictures), but without the bombs or mechas. Basically, some portals have transported creatures from Earth's past into another universe, and those creatures evolved. So now you have feathered crocodiles, giant flying slugs, aquatic pterosaurs, flutterfrogs, prawnwhales, homosexual four-legged birds and aquatic spinosaurs, among a whole lot of other crazy things.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

Okay then, I can understand why you would like it, But I personally don't care

The basic plot is that the Merging will apparently cause an accelerated heat death of the universe, So Kei along with the Friends he makes along the way, Have to find a way to Undo the effects of the Space/time oscillation bomb

topics.body: Does anyone here know how to increase your PC's RAM when you have already reached the limit? Let's say you have 4 slots and each has an 8gig stick which is the highest amount desktop RAM will go and thus have 32 GB. Instead of having to buy a CPU with quad channel memory and a board with 8 slots, is there a way you can add more RAM? I heard about a RAM expander card that can be used via pci but those are from way back and I din't think would work with a modern board or CPU plus it's only DDR which means even with 4 slots it's only a 4gig increase. I don't want to buy server RAM because it's expense and of course needs a server CPU and board to use it.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e
